metadata.title: CVE-2016-10061 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The ReadGROUP4Image function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick before7.0.1-10 does not check the return value of the fputc function, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a craftedimage file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.3').
